intro: Gymnacranthera suluensis, commonly known as the Sulu starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are often used in local cuisines. It thrives in tropical climates and is typically found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
